titleStmt.title: Joseph S. Long et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9286

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To His Excellency
The Governor of Kentucky.

The undersigned citizens of McCracken & Livingston Counties who are well acquainted ^with^ Mr James Carroll now of Smithland Ky -- state to your Excellency that they have known Mr Carroll for several years last past, and that he is a young-man of industrious habits and estimated amongst all his neighbors & acquaintances as having a good character for honestly & integrity -- That the only change they ever heard against his good name is that upon which he has Just been tried & condemned in the Livingston Circuit Court, () that he was in company with three other individuals about the first of April last when two of them in his absence at the time shot & killed a hog the owner of which was to the grand jury unknown -- The charge was Larceny and he was convicted upon the testimony of a witness who stated he was an accomplice -- & some outside corroborating evidence. -- The whole case and his previous good character are such as to induce us to ask of your Excellency to pardon him.

Names
Jos S Long
A S Jonnes
R. A. Thhmpson
James Slayter
A. B. Kindead
A D Moss
